alert.note: Alert for Barrow; Clarke; Jackson; Oconee; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 8:25AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Oconee, Barrow, west central Clarke, Walton and south central Jackson Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 825 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Pannell, or over Monroe, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Winder, Monroe, Auburn, Social Circle, Statham, Arcade, Bogart, Bethlehem, Between, Good Hope, Carl, Jersey, Athens-Clarke County, Bear Creek Reservoir, Ebenezer, Fort Yargo State Park, Bold Springs, Nicholasville, Pannell and Campton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
